content: More information would help. If the account is POP, most users set the account to download the message to PC and then delete from server, but that's an option. If IMAP, all messages remain on the server. If you tell us more about the accounts, someone here may have suggestions on reducing the space being used.
creator: davidsk

content: Ten Eset nesmí běžet ani na pozadí v procesech.
creator: poljos-moz

content: Dobrý den, děkuji. Antivirák používám placeny ESET, vypla jsem si tam zkušebně na 10 min. "Ochrana poštovních klientů" a Antispamová ochrana a nic. Stále bez obrázků. A doplňky nemám žádné. Bude to nějaká blbost, jen přijít jaká... ještě jednou děkuji.

content: Odhaduji to na činnost nějakého antiviráku. Zkus ho vypnout nebo přenastavit. Případně je na vině nějaký doplněk v Thunderbirdu.

content:
This morning Thunderbird updated to 102.15.1 (32 bit). I don't know what it was the previous 2 days since I had the issue start. Nothing had been added to or altered in Thunderbird or any other part of my system on the day the issue started. All other email accounts are operating the same as they always have. Only gmail (my primary) seems to have the problem.

Also are you able to tell me where I can now find the Options/Preferences please ?

content: The 'add star' feature is a toggle. Do it once and it stars the message; do it again and it unstars.

content: Try this: Help/Troubleshooting Info, scroll to the bottom, click 'Clear saved print settings', restart TB, see if it prints to the system default printer.
